title: Yield data preprocessing
text: depurate function returns object class paar. paar object contains cleaned data ($depurated_data), condition observation ($condition). condition NA means observation removed. summary function can used get summary percentage considered ouliers number observations removed. summary function returns data.frame object. Filtered dataset can extracted paar object using $depurated_data Final Yield values distribution can plotted. plot function can used plot yield values.  ggplot2 package can used plot yield values.  comparison can made original data cleaned data. Original data  Cleaned data  Also, distribution yield values can compared. Original data  Cleaned data
code: barley_clean_paar #> Depurated data has 5673 rows. #> The process removed 23% of original data. #>  #> $depurated_data #> Simple feature collection with 5673 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 581322.1 ymin: 5953094 xmax: 582393.3 ymax: 5954175 #> Projected CRS: WGS 84 / UTM zone 20S #> First 3 features: #>       Yield                 geometry #> 3  2.566069 POINT (582393.3 5953877) #> 36 3.217464 POINT (582373.4 5953843) #> 37 2.651020 POINT (582375.7 5953846) #>  #>  #> $condition #> vector of length 7394. First 3 elements: #> [1] "border" "border" NA summary_table <- summary(barley_clean_paar) summary_table #>       normal point             border spatial outlier MP spatial outlier LM  #>         5673 (77%)          964 (13%)         343 (4.6%)         309 (4.2%)  #>         global min            outlier  #>          99 (1.3%)         6 (0.081%) barley_clean <- barley_clean_paar$depurated_data plot(barley_clean["Yield"]) ggplot(barley_clean) +   geom_sf(aes(color = Yield)) +   scale_color_viridis_c() +   theme_minimal() ggplot(barley_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(color = Yield)) +   scale_color_viridis_c() +   theme_minimal() ggplot(barley_clean) +   geom_sf(aes(color = Yield)) +   scale_color_viridis_c() +   theme_minimal() ggplot(barley_sf, aes(x = Yield)) +   geom_histogram() #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. ggplot(barley_clean, aes(x = Yield)) +   geom_histogram() #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

what: Plotting the condition of each observation
title: Yield data preprocessing
text: condition observation can combined original data using cbind function. paar object must used first argument cbind function. barley_sf object now contains condition observation. condition column contains condition observation. condition can NA observation removed, edges observation removed edges step, outlier observation removed outliers step, inlier observation removed inliers step. Results can plotted visualize observations. plot function can used plot condition observation.  ggplot2 package can used plot condition observation.
code: barley_sf <- cbind(barley_clean_paar, barley_sf) plot(barley_sf[,'condition'], col = as.numeric(as.factor(barley_sf$condition))) legend("topright", legend = levels(as.factor(barley_sf$condition)), fill = 1:4) ggplot(barley_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(color = condition)) +   scale_fill_viridis_d() +   scale_color_discrete(     labels = function(k) {k[is.na(k)] <- "normal"; k},     na.value = "#44214234") +   theme_minimal()

what: Precision Agriculture Data Analysis in R
title: Precision Agriculture Data Analysis in R
text: goal paar provide useful functions precision agriculture spatial data depuration.

title: Precision Agriculture Data Analysis in R
text: can install development version GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("PPaccioretti/paar")

title: Precision Agriculture Data Analysis in R
text: package complete protocol automating error removal. Default values functions optimized precision agricultural data. barley data contains barley grain yield obtained using calibrated commercial yield monitors, mounted combines equipped DGPS. Spatial yield values depuration process can plotted  Also distribution yield values can plotted
code: library(paar) library(sf) #> Warning: package 'sf' was built under R version 4.3.3 data("barley", package = 'paar') #Convert barley data to an spatial object barley_sf <- st_as_sf(barley,                    coords = c("X", "Y"),                    crs = 32720)  barley_dep <-   depurate(barley_sf,            "Yield") #> Concave hull algorithm is computed with #> concavity = 2 and length_threshold = 0  # Summary of depurated data summary(barley_dep) #>       normal point             border spatial outlier MP spatial outlier LM  #>         5673 (77%)          964 (13%)         343 (4.6%)         309 (4.2%)  #>         global min            outlier  #>          99 (1.3%)         6 (0.081%) plot(barley_sf["Yield"], main = "Before depuration") plot(barley_dep$depurated_data["Yield"], main = "After depuration") boxplot(barley_sf[["Yield"]], main = "Before depuration") boxplot(barley_dep$depurated_data[["Yield"]], main = "After depuration")

title: Precision Agriculture Data Analysis in R
text: Vega, ., Córdoba, M., Castro-Franco, M. et al. (2019). Protocol automating error removal yield maps. Precision Agric 20, 1030–1044 https://doi.org/10.1007/s11119-018-09632-8 Paccioretti, P., Córdoba, M., & Balzarini, M. (2020). FastMapping: Software create field maps identify management zones precision agriculture. Computers Electronics Agriculture, 175, 105556 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compag.2020.105556.

title: Compare spatial zone means — compare_zone
text: Compare spatial zone means

title: Compare spatial zone means — compare_zone
code: compare_zone(   data,   variable,   zonesCol,   alpha = 0.05,   join = sf::st_nearest_feature,   returnLSD = FALSE,   grid_dim )

title: Compare spatial zone means — compare_zone
text: data sf object zones variable character sf object use mean comparison zonesCol character colname data zone specified alpha numeric Significance level use comparison join function use st_join variable sf object returnLSD logical LSD calculates spatial variance returned grid_dim numeric grid dimentins estimate spatial variance

title: Compare spatial zone means — compare_zone
text: list differences descriptive_stat

title: Compare spatial zone means — compare_zone
code: library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE data(wheat, package = "paar")  ##Convert to an sf object wheat <- sf::st_as_sf(wheat,                       coords = c("x", "y"),                       crs = 32720) clusters <- paar::kmspc(   wheat,   variables = c('CE30', 'CE90', 'Elev', 'Pe', 'Tg'),   number_cluster = 3:4 ) data_clusters <- cbind(wheat, clusters$cluster) compare_zone(data_clusters,              "Elev",              "Cluster_3") #> $differences #> $differences$Elev #>   Cluster_3     Elev                       geometry stat #> 3         3 160.2557 MULTIPOINT ((311982.8 58006...    a #> 1         1 160.9515 MULTIPOINT ((311962.8 58006...    b #> 2         2 161.2599 MULTIPOINT ((312192.8 58006...    c #>  #>  #> $descriptive_stat #> Key: <n> #>        n         Elev #>    <int>       <char> #> 1:  5982 160.89 (0.3) #>

what: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
text: Data can filtered null, edge values, global  outliers spatial outliers local defective observations. Default  values optimized precision agricultural data.

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
code: depurate(   x,   y,   toremove = c("edges", "outlier", "inlier"),   crs = NULL,   buffer = -10,   ylimitmax = NA,   ylimitmin = 0,   sdout = 3,   ldist = 0,   udist = 40,   criteria = c("LM", "MP"),   zero.policy = NULL,   poly_border = NULL )

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
text: x sf points object y character name variable use depuration process toremove character vector specifying procedure implement errors removal. Default 'edges', 'outlier', 'inlier'. See Details. crs coordinate reference system: integer EPSG code, character proj4string convert coordinates x longitude/latitude data buffer numeric distance meters removed. Negative values recommended ylimitmax numeric length 1 indicating maximum limit y variable. NA Inf assumed ylimitmin numeric length 1 indicating minimum limit y variable. NA -Inf assumed sdout numeric values outside interval \(mean ± sdout × sdout\) values removed ldist numeric lower distance bound identify neighbors udist numeric upper distance bound identify neighbors criteria character "LM" /"MP" methods identify spatial outliers zero.policy default NULL, use global option value; FALSE stop error empty neighbors sets, TRUE permit weights list formed zero-length weights vectors poly_border sf object one polygon NULL. Can result concaveman::concaveman

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
text: object class paar

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
text: Possible values toremove one elements : edges data points distance buffer m data   edges deleted. outlier Values outside mean±sdout removed inlier Local Moran index spatial autocorrelation calculated   datum tool identify inliers

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
text: Vega, ., Córdoba, M., Castro-Franco, M. et al. Protocol automating error removal yield maps. Precision Agric 20, 1030–1044 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1007/s11119-018-09632-8

title: Remove errors from spatial data — depurate
code: library(sf) data(barley, package = 'paar') #Convert to an sf object barley <- st_as_sf(barley,                    coords = c("X", "Y"),                    crs = 32720) depurated <-   depurate(barley,            "Yield") #> Concave hull algorithm is computed with #> concavity = 2 and length_threshold = 0  # Summary of depurated data summary(depurated) #>       normal point             border spatial outlier MP spatial outlier LM  #>         5673 (77%)          964 (13%)         343 (4.6%)         309 (4.2%)  #>         global min            outlier  #>          99 (1.3%)         6 (0.081%)   # Keep only depurate data depurated_data <- depurated$depurated_data # Combine the condition for all data all_data_condition <- cbind(depurated, barley)

title: Fuzzy k-means clustering — fuzzy_k_means
text: Performs vectorized fuzzy k-means clustering, procedure spatial. function almost wrapper function cmeans package e1071. intended used `KM-sPC` procedure possible data set 1 variable.

title: Fuzzy k-means clustering — fuzzy_k_means
code: fuzzy_k_means(   data,   variables,   number_cluster = 3:5,   fuzzyness = 1.2,   distance = "euclidean" )

title: Fuzzy k-means clustering — fuzzy_k_means
text: data sf object variables variables use clustering, missing, numeric variables used number_cluster numeric vector number final clusters fuzzyness number greater 1 giving degree fuzzification. distance character Must one following: "euclidean", mean square error, "manhattan", mean absolute error computed. Abbreviations also accepted.

title: Fuzzy k-means clustering — fuzzy_k_means
text: list classification results indices select best number clusters.

title: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering — kmspc
text: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering

title: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering — kmspc
code: kmspc(   data,   variables,   number_cluster = 3:5,   explainedVariance = 70,   ldist = 0,   udist = 40,   center = TRUE,   fuzzyness = 1.2,   distance = "euclidean",   zero.policy = FALSE,   only_spca_results = TRUE,   all_results = FALSE )

title: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering — kmspc
text: data sf object variables variables use clustering, missing, numeric variables used number_cluster numeric vector number final clusters explainedVariance numeric number percentage explained variance PCA analysis keep make cluster process ldist numeric lower distance bound identify neighbors udist numeric upper distance bound identify neighbors center logical numeric value, centring option TRUE, centring mean FALSE centring numeric vector, length must equal number columns data frame df gives decentring fuzzyness number greater 1 giving degree fuzzification. distance character Must one following: "euclidean", mean square error, "manhattan", mean absolute error computed. Abbreviations also accepted. zero.policy default NULL, use global option value; FALSE stop error empty neighbors sets, TRUE permit weights list formed zero-length weights vectors only_spca_results logical; return PCA sPCA results (FALSE), sPCA results (TRUE)? can time consuming process multiple variables. all_results logical; return results sPCA PCA call?

title: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering — kmspc
text: list classification results indices select best number clusters.

title: MULTISPATI-PCA clustering — kmspc
code: library(sf) data(wheat, package = 'paar')  # Transform the data.frame into a sf object wheat_sf <- st_as_sf(wheat,                      coords = c('x', 'y'),                      crs = 32720)  # Run the kmspc function kmspc_results <- kmspc(wheat_sf,                        number_cluster = 2:4) #> Warning: All numeric Variables will be used to make clusters  # Print the summaryResults kmspc_results$summaryResults #>   Clusters Iterations      SSDW #> 1        2         18 1.8713082 #> 2        3         39 1.3057409 #> 3        4         24 0.9948927  # Print the indices kmspc_results$indices #>   Num. Cluster     Xie Beni Partition Coefficient Entropy of Partition #> 1            2 3.520943e-05             0.9611984           0.06489999 #> 2            3 5.479512e-05             0.9391112           0.10430716 #> 3            4 5.825774e-05             0.9293076           0.12350410 #>   Summary Index #> 1      1.281173 #> 2      1.597661 #> 3      1.713110  # Print the cluster head(kmspc_results$cluster, 5) #>      Cluster_2 Cluster_3 Cluster_4 #> [1,] "2"       "3"       "2"       #> [2,] "2"       "3"       "2"       #> [3,] "2"       "3"       "2"       #> [4,] "2"       "2"       "2"       #> [5,] "2"       "2"       "2"        # Combine the results in a single object wheat_clustered <- cbind(wheat_sf, kmspc_results$cluster)  # Plot the results plot(wheat_clustered[, "Cluster_2"])

what: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
title: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
text: database wheat (Triticum aestivum L.) production field (60 ha) continuous agriculture, located south-eastern Pampas, Argentina.

title: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
code: wheat

title: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
text: data frame 5982 rows 7 variables: x X coordinate, meters y Y coordinate, meters CE30 apparent electrical conductivity taken 0–30 cm CE90 apparent electrical conductivity taken 0–90 cm Elev elevation, meters Pe soil depth, centimeters Tg wheat grain yield

title: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
text: Coordinate reference system "WGS 84 / UTM zone 20S", epsg:32720 Wheat grain yield recorded 2009 using calibrated commercial yield monitors mounted combines equipped DGPS. Soil ECa measurements taken using Veris 3100 (VERIS technologies enr., Salina, KS, USA). Soil depth measured using hydraulic penetrometer 30 × 30 m regular grid (Peralta et al., 2015). Re-gridding performed obtain values variables intersection point 10 × 10 m grid.

title: Database from a production field under continuous agriculture — wheat
text: N.R. Peralta, J.L. Costa, M. Balzarini, M. Castro Franco, M. Córdoba, D. Bullock Delineation management zones improve nitrogen management wheat Comput. Electron. Agric., 110 (2015), pp. 103-113, 10.1016/j.compag.2014.10.017 Paccioretti, P., Córdoba, M., & Balzarini, M. (2020). FastMapping: Software create field maps identify management zones precision agriculture. Computers Electronics Agriculture, 175, 105556.

title: paar 0.0.0.9003 (development version)
text: Now depurate function allows use MULTIPOLYGON objects. Build vignette kmspc function. Build vignette depurate function. New cbind.paar function bind condition one paar object data.frame sf object. Changed summary.paar removing print function. Added print.summary.paar function print summary paar object. Fixed check kmspc variables Typos fixed errors depurate function.
